intro: Phalacrodiscus ceratophylloides, commonly known as the horned sea holly, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Cymaraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, leaf-like structures that resemble horns, hence its common name. The plant thrives in shallow coastal waters and is often found in sandy or rocky substrates. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically arranged in dense clusters. Phalacrodiscus ceratophylloides plays a role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat for various small aquatic organisms.
